Quick start Guide¶

Contents

  • Quick start Guide
    • Step 1: Create your option file
      • Basic parameters
      • Heliocentric velocity correction parameters
    • Step 2: Run it

Step 1: Create your option file¶

Like ORBS, ORCS uses option files to load all the parameters needed. Here’s en example.

# option_file.orc

## ORCS option file

######################
## BASIC PARAMETERS ##
######################

CUBE_PATH NGC7635_R_1.8.fits
LINES [NII]6548,Halpha,[NII]6583,[SII]6716,[SII]6731 

SHIFT -0.5
FWHM 0.5 
FILTER_EDGES 648,677
POLY_ORDER 1 
ROI 30,60,290,340 

#########################
## OPTIONAL PARAMETERS ##
#########################

OBS_LAT 45.455000
OBS_LONG -71.153000
OBS_ALT 1100.
DATE 2012,6,17
HOUR_UT 04:30:00

Basic parameters¶

CUBE_PATH Path to the spectral cube

LINES Emission Lines names, enter an integer or a float to use a non_recorded emission line. See ORCSTools to get a list of the available lines.

SHIFT Spectral shift of the lines [in nm]

FWHM Rough FWHM of the lines [in nm]

FILTER_EDGES Edges of the filter filter_min,filter_max [in nm]

POLY_ORDER Order of the polynomial used to fit continuum

ROI Region of interest : Xmin,Xmax,Ymin,Ymax. Must be integers.

Heliocentric velocity correction parameters¶

OBS_LAT Observatory latitude

OBS_LONG Observatory longitude

OBS_ALT Observatory altitude

DATE Observation date

HOUR_UT Observation hour

Step 2: Run it¶

Warning

Don’t forget to put the correct path to ORBS in orcs/data.py

To run the option you must create a python script like this one:

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
# orcs_script.py

import sys, os
sys.path.append(os.path.expanduser("/path/to/Orcs")) # set Orcs Path

from orcs.orcs import * # import orcs module

sc = SpectralCube("option_file.orc") # Init extracting class
sc.extract_lines_maps() # start map extraction

You can then run this script with the command:

python orcs_script.py
